author: Adrian Dave Realuyo
artDescription: Every piece of who I used to be brought me closer to who I am today.

artTitle: You don't have to worry anymore, Ate is here
author: Leila Angelie Magdadaro
artDescription: As I rest on the soft grass of my memories, my younger self lies beside me, her heart heavy with a hopelessness that has lingered for years. I recall the moment when, at eleven, I felt left behind while my peers raced ahead, burdened by the belief that I would never be enough. Turning to her, I say, 'I've achieved so much since then, and you should be proud too,' and as she smiles, the weight of her pain begins to lift.

author: Adrian Dave Realuyo
artDescription: One day, my time here will fade into memory, and these hallways will belong to someone else’s footsteps. But for now, I leave a part of myself behind in every corner, every echo, every picture.

author: Dominic Basalo II
artImage: BASALO_Pictures on the Wall - Dominic Basalo Ii.png
artDescription: The future is just another picture to occupy the spaces on an empty wall.

author: The Third Man
artImage: THE THIRD MAN_Underneath The Cloudless Sky - YLAC PROVIDO.tiff

author: YuShan
artDescription: The future gazes in days bygone.

author: Earl Geibriel Dicipulo
artDescription: Four years feel like just yesterday, and yet here you are, staying with me. I miss you.

artTitle: Something Stored in Warm Plush Toys
author: Mokie
Sayu
artDescription: Remember who you are.... or what you were doing.

author: Elliot Dimasuhid
artDescription: Ang ganap na pokus ng yugto ng paghatol, hanggang sa tumunog ang huling palakpakan.

author: YuShan
artDescription: It's good to take care of plants, but don't forget to tend to your whole garden.

author: Annaliese Margarette Abrina
artImage: W2B Abrina Come along with me

author: Dominic Basalo II
artImage: W3 - Basalo A Store that sells Stories.png
artDescription: Perhaps the greatest memories begin in the simplest of places.

author: Pol
artImage: Pol_Where Broken Hearts Rest - John Paull Cua.png
artDescription: Nestled within the embrace of nature's chaos lies a sanctuary of solace and tranquility. It is a refuge where weary souls can retreat to find peace and rejuvenation after enduring heartache.

author: Hany
artImage: HANY_Everything Everywhere All at Once - Kianne Shannly Aleszandra Undalok.png
artDescription: Sucked into a Bagel

author: Elise
artImage: ELISE_Dawn’s quiet kiss - Annaliese Margarette Abrina
artDescription: The intimate nature of morning sunlight. It gives us a sense of calm, whether you are a child waking to a new day or an adult pausing to soak in a moment of peace.

author: Elise
artImage: ELISE_Wings of Yesterday - Annaliese Margarette Abrina
artDescription: The fleeting sense of childhood innocence and the simple joy of letting something take flight.

author: Jerelyn Hilay
artDescription: Three weeks of breathing clean air, she still misses the smoke. In a meadow of flowers and butterflies, her mind still paints images of blood and gore. The poet she has become cannot bury the warrior she once was. Old habits do not just die hard, they die screaming.

author: Elliot Dimasuhid
artDescription: Would you mind if I let a few little droplets of my dark, disgusting subconscious trickle out of them for a moment?

author: Adrian Dave Realuyo
artDescription: There's nothing much to do. I might as well just listen to the same 10 songs on repeat all day.

author: Tiffany Cantona
artImage: CANTONA_Wholeness in Whiskered Whimsy - Tiffany Cantona.jpg
artDescription: Creation and chaos intertwine to shape the identity, capturing the essence of memories and emotions that we cannot physically touch yet deeply feel. In this journey, the companion's presence supports the healing.

artTitle: Under the Tree, in the 5th Grade
author: Cornikopia
artImage: Under the Tree, in the 5th Grade - Shema Kailah Sacman
artDescription: Even after all these years, it's still you I look back on. We will never meet again, and that's beautiful. You were a tragedy, and I fell in love with that—with you.

author: Ayra
artImage: MAMAC_HUGIS NG GUNITA'T PANGARAP - Ira Zaky Mamac.jpg
artDescription: My mosaic-like face, made of fragmented pieces—I am shaped by the people I've encountered.

author: Elliot Dimasuhid
artDescription: Ang dahilan ‘di umano kung bakit sumisigaw ang mga kaluluwa sa purgatoryo ay dahil sila yaong sapilitang nakatikom ang bibig noong nasa mundo. At ang pinakamadilim na bahagi ng impyerno ay naka-reserba para sa mga piniling manahimik at nagtaksil sa kanilang kapwa.
